DOCNAME: CASE OF PEŠKOVÁ v. THE CZECH REPUBLIC
CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;Violation of P1-1;Pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Peer Lorenzen;Rait Maruste;Renate Jaeger;Zdravka Kalaydjieva
TEXT: CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant purchased a CARDINAL share in certain real estate in ORG which had been donated to the ORG by the original owners in DATE . The purchase price of CARDINAL NORP korunas ( CZK ) ( MONEY ( ORG ) ) for the whole property was fixed by an expert in DATE .
CARDINAL . At the time the application was lodged the property was being used by the applicant 's daughter and her family .

CARDINAL . On DATE , after the entry into force of Act no . CARDINAL ( “ LAW ” ) , a certain PERSON instituted restitution proceedings in LOC ( okresní soud ) against CARDINAL co - owners , including the applicant , seeking recovery of the property in issue by virtue of section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW . PERSON alleged that the acquisition of the property by the applicant and the other co - owners had been vitiated by a breach of the regulations in force at the time , that they had enjoyed an unlawful advantage , and that the price they had been required to pay had been lower than the real value of the property .

CARDINAL . On DATE , after the case had been examined by the courts at CARDINAL levels of jurisdiction DATE , ORG ruled against the applicant and the other co - owners and transferred the title to the property to P. , the daughter of the original plaintiff who had died in the meantime . In the course of the proceedings , several expert reports assessing the value of the disputed property at the time of its acquisition by the applicant had been produced at the request of ORG : an expert report valuating the property at CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) , an audit report by a company , PERSON , fixing the price at CZK MONEY ( ORG CARDINAL ) and an amendment to the audit report setting the price at CZK MONEY ( ORG CARDINAL ) . It emerged from this amendment that when valuing the property the earlier reports had been based on the correct price regulation but certain interpretative directives ( směrnice a pokyny ) issued by ORG had been disregarded . The court found on the one hand that the defendants had acquired the property at a lower price than that required by the law in force at the material time . On the other hand , the plaintiff had failed to establish that they had enjoyed an unlawful advantage when acquiring the property , in that the father of CARDINAL of them was a member of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( krajský soud ) upheld the judgment of the first - instance court . It accepted the conclusions set out in the amendment to the audit report , as the reasons for the difference in prices had been satisfactorily explained . Thus , it considered a new audit , as suggested by the applicant , to be superfluous . ORG judgment became final on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) , without holding a public hearing , dismissed the applicant 's appeal on points of law ( dovolání ) of DATE , stating , inter alia , as follows :

“ The court of cassation finds well - founded [ the applicant 's ] arguments challenging the legal conclusions of the audit report . ... There was no reason to apply ... the particular provision of LAW ( CARDINAL ) of LAW , which only concerned expropriation and was intended to protect persons from whom real estate was taken ...

Despite this interpretation ... , the court of cassation could not grant the applicant 's request to quash as incorrect the judgment of the appellate court . Even if the wear and tear [ to the property ] had not been calculated at PERCENT , as applied by the amendment to the audit report , but at PERCENT , as applied in the previous expert reports , the price ... fixed under LAW would have been higher than the purchase price agreed between the parties ... The difference in the prices is thus not based on the subjective valuation of the expert or his interpretation of LAW , but also on the smaller surface area considered by the original expert ... [ as well as ] the wrong classification of the construction ... In these circumstances , the finding of the appellate court that the defendants had acquired the disputed property at a price lower than that established by LAW is correct ... ” .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( PERSON ) dismissed a constitutional appeal by the applicant ( ústavní stížnost ) in which she alleged , in particular , a violation of LAW ( right to property ) and CARDINAL § CARDINAL ( right to judicial protection ) of LAW ( Listina základních práv a svobod ) .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE the applicant was reimbursed by ORG her share of the purchase price of the property , corresponding to CZK CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( EUR CARDINAL ) . Moreover , ORG proposed the applicant and the other co - owners a sum of CZK MONEY ( EUR CARDINAL ) in compensation for the costs reasonably incurred for the upkeep of the property . That sum was fixed by an expert and the applicant was ready to accept it . However , due to an objection by P. , the new owner of the property , against whom ORG would have had a counterclaim , that sum was not paid out . In a letter of CARDINAL DATE , ORG advised the applicant to seek that compensation by means of a civil action against ORG . The applicant failed to do so however .

CARDINAL . In an expert report produced for the purposes of inheritance proceedings after the applicant 's father ( one of the co - owners ) had died on DATE , the disputed property was valued at CZK MONEY ( EUR CARDINAL ) . According to a resolution of the GPE CARDINAL ORG of DATE , the CARDINAL share left by the deceased was acquired by the applicant . The resolution became final on DATE .

CARDINAL . In a letter of DATE ORG informed the applicant that it had found that her right to a determination of her civil claim within a reasonable time had been violated and that she had been awarded CZK CARDINAL ( ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) in non - pecuniary damages for the length of the restitution proceedings . In a letter of DATE the applicant informed the ORG that she did not wish to pursue her claim before the domestic courts .
